N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 901.13 - Transfers of interest by sole proprietors or general partners

State Regulations
(a) Any change in
the sole proprietor who or general partners of a partnership which is the
operator of a life care community must receive the prior approval of the Life

Care Community Council. In the event such change is occasioned by the death of
an operator, the department shall be notified immediately and application shall
be made for approval of such change within 30 days of such death. A sole
proprietor or partnership seeking the council's approval for the transfer of
all or part of the ownership of the business shall file, in addition to meeting
the other applicable requirements of this Part, the applicable information, documents and data as follows: (1)
a
certified copy of the applicant's existing or executed proposed certificate of
doing business; (2)
a photocopy of
any corporate applicant's executed, existing or proposed certificate of
incorporation; (3)
where the
applicant is a partnership, copies of all partnership agreements; (4)
a declaration of the percentage of the
business to be transferred; (5)
a
financial statement setting forth the purchase price of the interest in the
business being sold and the financial resources available to make such
purchase, or the basis on which such transfer is to be financed; (6)
where any transfer is to be by gift, a
statement of the relationship between the donor and donee; (7)
information as to the character, experience, competence and standing in the community of the
applicant; (8)
where the applicant
proposes a change of name by which the community is doing business, a photocopy
of the executed proposed certificate of doing business; and
(9)
such additional pertinent information or
documents necessary for the council's consideration, as requested. (b) Any transfer pursuant to this
section shall be completed within 90 days of the issuance by the Life Care

Community Council of its approval for such transfer unless extended by the
commissioner, and the council shall be notified of the transfer within 10 days
after its completion. Any request for an extension of time shall set forth the
reasons why such transfer could not be completed within the prescribed time. Failure to complete a transfer within the time prescribed or as extended by the
council or failure to notify the council within the time prescribed shall
constitute an abandonment and withdrawal of the application and any council
approval. Notes
